From the MFA website:

At Home in Utopia by Boston Jewish Film Festival founder Michal Goldman with Ellen Brodsky (2008, 57 min., video). In the 1920s, thousands of immigrant Jewish garment workers put a new spin on the American dream by building four big, beautiful, cooperatively owned apartment complexes in the Bronx. At Home in Utopia is the story of the struggle for equity and racial justice in the most radical of the houses ? the United Workers Cooperative Colony, aka the Coops. In English and Yiddish with English subtitles.

Filmmakers present for all screenings. June 12 screening preceded by a brief concert by A Besere Velt (A Better World), Yiddish Community Chorus of the Workmen?s Circle. Additional special guests: June 15, Matt Thall, Housing and Community Development activist; June 19, Dr. Alvin Poussaint, Psychiatrist, Media Consultant, Author; June 22, author Vivian Gornick; July 3, Jeff Crosby, President, IUE-CWA Local 201.

Here is a link to an intriguing review of this documentary which inspired me to take the time to see it:

http://www.boston.com...

Hope to see you there,
Susan
